lead_paragraph: The 2G spectrum case continues to dominate headlines as the Central Bureau of Investigation on Monday booked former Telecom Minister and DMK leader Dayanidhi Maran and his brother, media baron Kalanithi Maran. (Hindustan Times). The bureau conducted simultaneous searches on their houses and offices. Mr. Maran is accused of receiving kickbacks from Malaysia-based company Maxis immediately after it acquired Aircell for $800 million (Times of India).

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Tuesday
